'''Islamabad''' ({{IPAc-en|ɪ|z|ˈ|l|ɑː|m|ə|ˌ|b|ɑː|d}}; {{lang-ur|{{Nastaliq| اسلام آباد}}}}, {{transl|ur|'''Islāmābād'''}}, {{IPA-hns|ɪsˌlɑːmɑˈbɑːd̪|ur}}) is the capital city of [[Pakistan]] located within the federal [[Islamabad Capital Territory]]. With a population of two million, it is the [[List of most populous cities in Pakistan|10th largest]] city of [[Pakistan]], while the larger [[Islamabad-Rawalpindi metropolitan area]] is the third largest in Pakistan with a population exceeding five million.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.pbs.gov.pk/sites/default/files//tables/POPULATION%20SIZE%20AND%20GROWTH%20OF%20MAJOR%20CITIES.pdf |title=Population size and growth of major cities |publisher=[[Pakistan Bureau of Statistics]] |date=1998}}</ref><ref name="ses">{{cite web|last=Frantzeskakis|first=J. M.|title=Islamabad, a town planning example for a sustainable city|url=http://www.ses.gr/docs/edeltia/elvima139_Islamabad_Skiathos.pdf}}</ref><ref name="population2">{{cite news|url=http://www.dawn.com/news/740350/islamabads-population-touches-two-million-mark|title=Islamabad's population touches two-million mark|date=7 August 2012|newspaper=The Dawn News|accessdate=24 December 2013}}</ref> The city is the political seat of Pakistan and is administered by the [[Islamabad Metropolitan Corporation]], supported by the [[Capital Development Authority]] (CDA).

Islamabad is located in the [[Pothohar Plateau]] in the northeastern part of the country, between [[Rawalpindi District]] and the [[Margalla Hills National Park]] to the north. The region has historically been a part of the crossroads of [[Punjab, Pakistan|Punjab]] and [[Khyber Pakhtunkhwa]] with the Margalla Pass acting as the gateway between the two regions.<ref name="Islamabadnet">{{cite web|title=Islamabad|publisher=Islamabad.net|url=http://www.pakistan.net/cities/islamabad/islamabad.htm}}</ref> 

Islamabad was built during the 1960s to replace [[Karachi]] as Pakistan's capital. The city's master-plan divides the city into eight zones, including administrative, diplomatic enclave, residential areas, educational sectors, industrial sectors, commercial areas, and rural and green areas. The city is known for the presence of several parks and forests, including the [[Margalla Hills National Park]] and [[Shakarparian|Shakarparian Park]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.visitislamabad.net/islamabad/files/file-detail.asp?var=history-of-islamabad|title=Capital Development Authority|website=www.visitislamabad.net|access-date=2016-06-07}}</ref> The city is home to several landmarks, including the [[Faisal Mosque]], the [[List of mosques in Pakistan|largest mosque]] in South Asia<ref name="Gordon Melton">{{cite book|title=Religions of the World: A Comprehensive Encyclopedia of Beliefs and Practices|publisher=ABC-CLIO|isbn=978-1598842036|url=https://books.google.com/?id=v2yiyLLOj88C&pg=PA1972&dq=Faisal+Mosque+largest#v=onepage&q=Faisal%20Mosque%20largest&f=false|edition=2nd|editor=J. Gordon Melton, Martin Baumann|accessdate=15 May 2012|page=1972|chapter=Mosques|date=21 September 2010}}</ref> and the [[List of largest mosques|fourth largest]] in the world. Other landmarks include the [[Pakistan Monument|Pakistan's National Monument]] and [[D-Chowk (Islamabad)|Democracy Square]].<ref name="Noyes Mass">{{cite book|title=Back to Pakistan: A Fifty-Year Journey|publisher=Rowman & Littlefield Publishers|isbn=978-1442213197|url=https://books.google.com.pk/books?id=_BtWtuLlDXoC&pg=PA170#v=onepage&q&f=false|author=Leslie Noyes Mass|accessdate=1 July 2012|page=170|date=15 September 2011}}</ref><ref name="Ravi Kalia">{{cite book|title=Pakistan: From the Rhetoric of Democracy to the Rise of Militancy|publisher=Routledge|location=Pakistan|isbn=978-0415670401|url=https://books.google.com.pk/books?id=86b0MINe_gsC&pg=PA83#v=onepage&q&f=false|author=Ravi Kalia|accessdate=1 July 2012|page=83|date=21 April 2011}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://tribune.com.pk/story/596791/national-monument-structure-reflects-history-of-pakistan/|title=National Monument: Structure reflects history of Pakistan  - The Express Tribune|date=2013-08-29|website=The Express Tribune|language=en-US|access-date=2016-06-13}}</ref> 

Islamabad is a [[Global city|beta- world city]];<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lboro.ac.uk/gawc/world2016t.html |title=GaWC – The World According to GaWC 2016 |publisher=lboro.ac.uk |date=15 April 2017 |accessdate=24 April 2017}}</ref> it is categorised as [[List of districts of Pakistan by Human Development Index|very high]] on the [[Human Development Index]], the highest in the country. The city has the highest [[cost of living]] in Pakistan, and its population is dominated by [[Middle class|middle]] and [[Upper middle class|upper middle]] class citizens.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.dawn.com/news/1095012|title=Islamabad — a city only for the rich?|last=Hetland|first=Atle|date=2014-03-23|newspaper=DAWN.COM|access-date=2016-10-23}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://nation.com.pk/islamabad/29-Sep-2014/g-12-a-sector-housing-rich-poor-alike|title=G-12, a sector housing  rich, poor alike|newspaper=The Nation|language=en-US|access-date=2016-10-23}}</ref> The city is home to sixteen universities, including the [[Quaid-i-Azam University|Quaid-e-Azam University]] and [[National University of Sciences and Technology, Pakistan|NUST]].<ref name="HEC Rankings">{{cite web|title=HEC University Rankings by Category|author=HEC, Pakistan|url=http://beta.hec.gov.pk/InsideHEC/Divisions/QALI/Others/RankingofUniversities/Pages/CategoryWise.aspx}}</ref> The city is one of the safest in Pakistan, and has an expansive surveillance system with 1,900 [[CCTV]] cameras.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://tribune.com.pk/story/1117621/safe-city-project-gets-operational-islooites-promised-safety/|title=Safe City Project gets operational: Islooites promised safety - The Express Tribune|date=2016-06-06|website=The Express Tribune|language=en-US|access-date=2016-06-07}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://nation.com.pk/islamabad/28-Mar-2015/crime-rate-in-islamabad-drops-claim-police|title=Crime rate in Islamabad drops, claim police|website=The Nation|language=en-US|access-date=2016-06-07}}</ref>
